projects.title: Portfolio-v2 (AI Part)
projects.description: This project, which corresponds to this website, integrates a RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) system combined with a Mistral LLM. The data used to power the RAG is based on myself, allowing it to answer any questions you might have about me.

projects.title: SnakeAI
projects.description: This project involves implementing reinforcement learning in a snake game. The snake has very limited vision, and the goal is to achieve the longest possible length through learning.

projects.title: Gomoku
projects.description: The goal of this project is to develop an AI capable of beating a human player in the game of Gomoku. It uses the Mini-Max Algorithm with Alpha-Beta Pruning, combined with other optimization techniques for better performance.

projects.title: LinearRegression
projects.description: This project serves as an introduction to a fundamental concept in machine learning: linear regression. The idea is to build a program that predicts the price of a car based on its mileage using a linear regression model trained with a gradient descent algorithm.

projects.title: Portfolio-v2 (Web Part)
projects.description: This new version of my portfolio is built with Nuxt for the frontend and FastAPI for the backend. It gave me the opportunity to build a complete fullstack application, exploring essential software development concepts, followed by a secure deployment.
This still-unreleased project is a full blend of all my knowledge: AI, design, DevOps, user data management and more. It’s a major milestone in my journey as a developer.

projects.title: Rubik's Cube Solver
projects.description: The aim of this project was to develop a program capable of solving a Rubik’s Cube using as few moves as possible. Created as a team of two, I mainly worked on the frontend, built with Vue and Three.Js, to produce a nice animated 3D visualization.

projects.title: Weather3D
projects.description: A simple weather app built in SwiftUI with a user-friendly interface using the OpenWeather API. It features 3D models rendered with SceneKit that adapt based on the weather and time of day.

projects.title: ScreenTimeApp
projects.description: This project involved developing an app that can lock access to selected apps for a set or indefinite period, using Apple’s ScreenTime API.

projects.title: SwiftyCompanion
projects.description: This project is an internal app for my school, using the 42 API to provide various information about students. It’s a great project for learning how to handle APIs efficiently.

projects.title: Tododev
projects.description: A collaborative to-do list app. The concept is to generate tasks tailored to each user's profile with the help of AI.

experiences.description: Working on a new project that is still under wraps.
Working on a project to improve the bank's internal tools and processes.
